decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana through various rituals and fast mana sources, while digging through the deck for key combo pieces using cantrips like Ponder and Preordain. The deck aims to assemble the Storm combo by casting a critical mass of spells in one turn, followed by a Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in one large storm count. In order to protect the combo, cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Veil of Summer are included to disrupt opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to mill cards from the library and fill the graveyard with creatures, enabling powerful combo plays. By constantly dredging cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, the deck aims to quickly assemble a board presence with cards like Narcomoeba and Ichorid. Cabal Therapy and Bridge from Below provide disruption and synergize with the graveyard strategy. The deck aims to win by overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of creatures or by reanimating powerful threats like Ashen Rider or Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis.

The deck is focused on quickly assembling a game-winning combo by using a combination of fast mana, free creatures, and powerful spells. The goal is to mill cards from the library, putting creatures like Narcomoeba and Thassa's Oracle into play to win the game immediately. The deck runs minimal disruption and protection spells, relying on speed and consistency to execute its combo efficiently. By quickly cycling through the deck and using efficient mana sources, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The key concept of this Aggro - Canadian Threshold deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by playing efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Dreadhorde Arcanist, and Sprite Dragon while disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game through card advantage engines like Sylvan Library and powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns. Additionally, the deck utilizes a mana denial strategy with cards like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and secure victory through incremental damage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana and play powerful artifact cards, combining aggressive strategies with blue control elements. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Lotus Petal to ramp up mana production, players can drop threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Urza, Lord High Artificer early in the game. The deck also features disruptive elements such as Chalice of the Void and Narset, Parter of Veils to control the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient creatures like Eldrazi Mimic, Reality Smasher, and Thought-Knot Seer. It uses acceleration from cards like Elvish Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb to deploy threats quickly. Chalice of the Void disrupts opponents' game plans while cards like Dismember and Wasteland provide removal and disruption. The deck also includes consistency tools like Once Upon a Time and Mishra's Factory to ensure a strong early game presence and maintain pressure throughout the match.

The deck focuses on quickly putting powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play from the graveyard using cards like Entomb, Shallow Grave, and Goryo's Vengeance. It aims to disrupt the opponent with cards like Cabal Therapy, Thoughtseize, and Force of Will while rapidly cycling through the deck with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck also utilizes Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate mana quickly and allow for explosive turns. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can effectively respond.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using acceleration like Chrome Mox and Green Sun's Zenith, in order to cast powerful threats like Progenitus and Eldrazi creatures. It also disrupts the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere. The deck aims to apply pressure early with aggressive creatures like Questing Beast and Shifting Ceratops while also having resilient threats like Thragtusk and Garruk, Unleashed. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruption while utilizing fast mana to gain an advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ashen Rider into play by utilizing cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Exhume. The deck aims to fill the graveyard with big creatures early on and then bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. Additionally, cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Sire of Insanity can disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Unmask and Thoughtseize can help protect the combo pieces and ensure a smooth execution of the reanimation strategy.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the board using disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Plague Engineer, while also having access to removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to ramp up its mana using creatures like Noble Hierarch and Knight of the Reliquary to eventually play powerful threats like Questing Beast and Hexdrinker. The inclusion of cards like Gaea's Cradle and Green Sun's Zenith allows the deck to generate more mana and search for key creatures, making it a versatile and resilient control deck.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping into powerful Eldrazi creatures using Cloudpost lands and the support cards like Crop Rotation and Green Sun's Zenith. The goal is to assemble a strong board presence with Primeval Titan fetching additional lands and the ability to search for key lands like Eye of Ugin or Dark Depths. The deck also includes disruption with Pithing Needle and Reclamation Sage to deal with opposing threats. The main strategy revolves around accelerating mana production to overwhelm opponents with high-impact threats.

This Legacy Enchantress combo deck focuses on using enchantments to generate card advantage and mana ramp, while controlling the opponent's board through removal and disruption. The deck aims to set up a lock by combining cards like Rest in Peace and Helm of Obedience, while also utilizing cards like Destiny Spinner and Solitary Confinement for protection. The deck's strategy revolves around enchantress effects to draw cards and build a strong board presence, ultimately overwhelming the opponent with a powerful enchantment-based engine.

The deck aims to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures using self-mill cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Satyr Wayfinder. This allows for early casting of Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine, which can overwhelm the opponent in the early game. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Altar of Dementia and Bridge from Below to create an infinite combo loop that can quickly close out the game. The strategy revolves around building a critical mass of creature cards in the graveyard to power up its combo potential and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Abrupt Decay to disrupt the opponent's game plan while leveraging the graveyard with Life from the Loam and Sevinne's Reclamation to generate value. It also includes powerful threats like Dark Confidant and Knight of the Reliquary to pressure opponents. The use of Chalice of the Void and Mox Diamond helps to control the board while the mana base provides versatility and access to multiple colors for flexibility in casting spells. The deck aims to grind out advantages over time and outlast opponents in longer games.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Aluren combo to cast creatures for free and generate value through bouncing them back to hand. It includes various value creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The presence of Yorion as a companion adds a powerful blink effect to the deck, allowing for additional value and protection. The deck aims to establish a board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy, ultimately leading to a win through overwhelming board state and resource advantage.

This deck focuses on putting early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dreadhorde Arcanist, backed up by disruption spells like Daze and Force of Will. It also utilizes card selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to ensure a consistent draw. The key strategy revolves around tempo plays and maintaining control of the game through countermagic, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt to finish off opponents. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's aggressive game plan.
